bibl.title: 'Remain Like Stones, Unmoving, Un-running': Another Greek Spell Against Competitors in a Foot-race.
bibl.note: Lead tablet (78 by 118 mm) in a private collection (Fayez Barakat). Said to have been found in Egypt, 4th century AD. Elaborate binding spell with intervening sequences of magical words (voces magicae), directed against three athletes, evidently runners.
bibl.seg: TOMLIN R.S.O., 'Remain Like Stones, Unmoving, Un-running': Another Greek Spell Against Competitors in a Foot-race.

Lead tablet (78 by 118 mm) in a private collection (Fayez Barakat). Said to have been found in Egypt, 4th century AD. Elaborate binding spell with intervening sequences of magical words (voces magicae), directed against three athletes, evidently runners.
